intro: Miconia tillettii, commonly known as the Tilt's miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It often grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
